text.section: The Secretary shall adopt regulations to stagger the terms of the licenses.
A license expires on the date the Secretary sets, in accordance with subsection (a) of this section.

At least 2 months before a license expires, the Board shall send to the licensee, by first-class mail or electronically, to the last known address of the licensee:
A renewal application form; and
A notice that states:
The date on which the current license expires;
The date by which the Board must receive the renewal application for the renewal to be issued and mailed before the license expires; and
The amount of the renewal fee.

section.section: A licensee shall complete 12 hours of continuing education instruction covering marine contractor subject matter approved by the Board.

The Board shall approve the substance and form of a continuing education course if the course is:
Offered by a qualified instructor; or
Conducted by an educational institution approved by the Board.
The licensee is responsible for the cost of any continuing education course.

text.section: The Board shall renew the license of each licensee who meets the requirements of this section.
